author: Staff Reporter
text:
A special election flying squad swooped on a marriage ceremony of an All India Anna Dravida Munnetra Kazhagam functionary in Periyakulam near here on Thursday after receiving a tip-off that the party cadres had erected several banners containing Chief Minister Jayalalithaa’s portraits, party symbol and party flags outside the marriage hall.

Gift bags given to visitors also had Ms. Jayalalithaa’s portrait. AIADMK union secretary Chellamuthu had arranged the marriage for his son Muthu Pandian at the hall.

When the flying squad members conducted an enquiry, the family members replied that they had obtained permission from the Election Commission to erect banners and flags for the marriage. The officials warned that they should produce an order or permission letter for the same failing which cases would be registered against them. Later, they left the place.

Flags, banners removed

Meanwhile, the cadres started removing the flags and banners.
title: Flying squad raids marriage hall in Periyakulam
